actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on January 16, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification of the issuance of an Executive Order in order to take additional steps with respect to the national emergency declared in Executive Order 13894 of October 14, 2019 (Blocking Property and Suspending Entry of Certain Persons Contributing to the Situation in Syria)
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-12).

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating that the national emergency with respect to the widespread humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan and the potential for a deepening economic collapse in Afghanistan declared in Executive Order 14064 of February 11, 2022, is to continue in effect beyond February 11, 2025
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committees on Foreign Affairs and Financial Services and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 119-11).
Mr. Dunn (FL) asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 9:00 a.m. on January 16. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 44 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 43 — "Providing for the attendance of the House at the Inaugural Ceremonies of the President and Vice President of the United States."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 42 — "Electing Members to certain standing committees of the House of Representatives."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 423
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 15).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 33 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide special rules for the taxation of certain residents of Taiwan with income from sources within the United States."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 423
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 14).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 144 — "To provide that the Federal Reports Elimination and Sunset Act of 1995 does not apply to certain reports required to be submitted by the Tennessee Valley Authority, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 419
actions-list.actionItem: 2 (Roll no. 13).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 164 — "To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to authorize Federal agencies to provide certain essential assistance for hazard mitigation for electric utilities, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules and on passage of H.R. 33, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 33, the Chair put the question on passage and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Smith (MO) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 33.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 5. H.R. 33 — "To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide special rules for the taxation of certain residents of Taiwan with income from sources within the United States."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Ansari to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of January 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Monica De La Cruz to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
